programme.title: Men's Bronze Medal Match CAN vs USA - Curling | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 18/02/2022 at the Nat. Aquatics Ctr - Sheet B. Final Score: CAN 8:5 USA. Canada won the bronze medal.

programme.title: Strangest Moments | Episode 3
programme.desc: In this episode: a fencing time crisis, the Akhwari story, the fake Olympic torch, Khalid Skah's 10k controversy, and Sven Kramer's amazing error.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 5
programme.desc: Beamon leaps into history, women's downhill too close to call, Al Oerter, Dutch dominate skating, and USA 4x100 nail the handover.

programme.title: Women's 1000 m - Speed Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 17/02/2022 at the National Speed Skating Oval. A new Olympic Record was achieved by gold medalist Miho Takagi (JPN) with 1:13.19, Jutta Leerdam (NED) claimed the Silver while Brittany Bowe (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 6
programme.desc: A new Trinidad star throws himself into the record books, Killy leaves his mark, oldest Olympians, and Kenyan Steeplechase dominance.

programme.title: France’s Martin Fourcade | Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the amazing Olympic achievements of France’s five-time gold medallist Martin Fourcade, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: Bjørndalen Earns 'King Of Biathlon' Status
programme.desc: Ole Einar Bjørndalen dominated biathlon and his incredible Olympic medal haul has him revered in his native Norway and across the world.

programme.title: Olympic Flame Handover Ceremony | Athens | Milano Cortina 2026
programme.desc: Watch the Olympic flame handover ceremony for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026 at the Panathenaic Stadium in Athens, Greece. Commentary available in English and Italian.

programme.title: Men's 50 km Mass Start - Cross-Country Skiing | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the Zhangjiakou Crs-Ctry Ctr. Alexander Bolshunov (ROC) claimed the gold medal. Ivan Yakimushkin (ROC) took home the silver and Simen Hegstad Krueger (NOR) completed the podium, with bronze.

programme.title: 2-Woman Heats 3 & 4 - Bobsleigh | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the Yanqing Sliding Centre. Laura Nolte (GER) claimed the gold medal. Mariama Jamanka (GER) won the silver, while Elana Meyers Taylor (USA) took home the bronze.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 1
programme.desc: Usain's Insane 100m record, Norway's close finish, an Aussie Winter Olympian, South Korea archery domination, Perfect Comaneci.

programme.title: France’s Martin Fourcade | Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the amazing Olympic achievements of France’s five-time gold medallist Martin Fourcade, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: Into the Unknown
programme.desc: Into the Unknown follows the world’s top ski mountaineers including Oriol Cardona, Alba De Silvestro, Marianne Fatton and Thibault Anselmet as they chase one of their most crucial goals: qualifying for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026. Set against the dramatic Arctic landscapes of Tromsø, the documentary captures one of the final and most decisive events of the qualification season. Battling darkness, brutal weather and unforgiving terrain, the athletes push their bodies and minds to the edge while navigating the pressure of earning their Olympic spot. Through intimate moments, raw emotion, and the intense beauty of Norway’s mountains, the film reveals the true cost of ambition in a sport where every climb is a test of character and courage.

programme.title: Men's & Women's Mass Start - Speed Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the National Speed Skating Oval. In the Men´s Final, the gold medal was claimed by Bart Swings (BEL), while Jae Won Chung (KOR) won the silver and Seung Hoon Lee (KOR) took the bronze. In the Women´s, Irene Schouten (NED) claimed the victory and the gold medal, Ivanie Blondin (CAN) won the silver and Francesca Lollobrigida (ITA) took the bronze.

programme.title: Women's Bronze Medal Match SWE vs SUI - Curling | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the Nat. Aquatics Ctr - Sheet B. Final Score: SWE 9:7 SUI. Sweden took home the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Men's Gold Medal Match SWE vs GBR - Curling | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the Nat. Aquatics Ctr - Sheet B. Final Score: SWE 5:4 GBR. Sweden won the final and took home Gold, Great Britain Silver and Canada the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Into the Unknown
programme.desc: Into the Unknown follows the world’s top ski mountaineers including Oriol Cardona, Alba De Silvestro, Marianne Fatton and Thibault Anselmet as they chase one of their most crucial goals: qualifying for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026. Through intimate moments, raw emotion, and the intense beauty of Norway’s mountains, the film reveals the true cost of ambition in a sport where every climb is a test of character and courage.

programme.title: Olympic Flame Handover Ceremony | Athens | Milano Cortina 2026
programme.desc: Watch the Olympic flame handover ceremony for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026 at the Panathenaic Stadium in Athens, Greece. Commentary available in English and Italian.

programme.title: Men's Bronze Medal Match SWE vs SVK - Ice Hockey | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 19/02/2022 at the National Indoor Stadium. Final Score: SVK 4:0 SWE. Slovakia claimed the bronze medal.

programme.title: Drop-In with Arianna Fontana Part 1
programme.desc: Olympic legend Arianna Fontana joins her husband and coach, Anthony Lobello, for a warm, light-hearted cooking session as they prepare Pizzoccheri, a traditional dish from her Valtellina roots. Filled with banter, teamwork and personal stories, the episode offers an intimate glimpse into their life beyond the ice.

programme.title: Men's 4x7.5km Relay - Biathlon | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 15/02/2022 at the Zhangjiakou Biathlon Ctr. Norway won the Gold, while France claimed the Silver and the ROC team completed the podium.

programme.title: Into the Unknown
programme.desc: Into the Unknown follows the world’s top ski mountaineers including Oriol Cardona, Alba De Silvestro, Marianne Fatton and Thibault Anselmet as they chase one of their most crucial goals: qualifying for the Olympic Winter Games Milano Cortina 2026. Set against the dramatic Arctic landscapes of Tromsø, the documentary captures one of the final and most decisive events of the qualification season. Battling darkness, brutal weather and unforgiving terrain, the athletes push their bodies and minds to the edge while navigating the pressure of earning their Olympic spot. Through intimate moments, raw emotion, and the intense beauty of Norway’s mountains, the film reveals the true cost of ambition in a sport where every climb is a test of character and courage.

programme.title: Pairs Short Program Final - Figure Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 18/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium. Wenjing Sui (CHN) and Cong Han (CHN) qualified for the finals with the best score in the Pairs Short Program.

programme.title: Vancouver 2010 Historical Flashback: Figure Skating Ladies' Single Skating
programme.desc: Before going to Vancouver 2010 we have a quick look back at Calgary 1988, Nagano 1998 and Salt Lake City 2002

programme.title: Meet this Big, Competitive Ice Dance Family | On Edge
programme.desc:
Meet the six teams training together at the Ice Academy of Montreal in Canada for the Olympic Games Beijing 2022. Gabriella and Guillaume reflect on their PyeongChang experience. Madison and Zach have some on-ice tension and speak about their emotional connection and Scott Moir tells us what it takes to be an Olympic champion. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.
Featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: A Mountain of Problems to Solve | On Edge
programme.desc: It is 5 months until Beijing 2022 and as coach Romain Haguenauer puts it: “There is a mountain of problems to solve” technically, artistically and physically for the athletes to be ready. In this second episode of the weekly series On Edge, get an intimate look at how the coaching system at the Academy operates and what it takes to prep the athletes’ programs. Madison and Evan reveal their new routine theme and work on the costume design. Olivia and Adrian perform their new program in front of the coaches and training mates for the first time. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly ice dancing reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Big Last-Minute Changes | On Edge
programme.desc: Madison and Evan take the risk of changing their program’s music in the last minute. Madison and Zach are headed to Boston for their first competition of the season. Olivia and Adrian reflect on the coaches’ disappointment and work on improvements. Laurence and Nikolaj open up about Nikolaj’s injury and road to recovery. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Last Touches Before the Start of the Season | On Edge
programme.desc: The teams are prepping for one of the first major competitions of the season: Finlandia Trophy. Madison and Evan take their music changes to the rink. Lilah and Lewis reflect on how they started ice dancing together revealing that their targets are both Beijing 2022 and Cortina 2026. Madison Hubbell tries on costumes and speaks out about her relationship with Adrian. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Gala exhibition - Figure Skating | Beijing 2022 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 20/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium.

programme.title: Team Event, Day 1 - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The event - featuring men's and pairs short programs - was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 9 February 2018.

programme.title: How Malaysia’s first Olympic figure skater made history in PyeongChang
programme.desc: The emotional full story of how Julian Yee trained in a Malaysian mall in order to make history at the 2018 Olympic Winter Games.

programme.title: Women's Free Skating - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The women's free skating was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 23 February 2018.

programme.title: Women's Free Skating Final - Figure Skating | Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022
programme.desc: This event took place on 17/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium. Anna Shcherbakova (ROC) won the gold medal with 255.95 points. Her teammate Alexandra Trusova (ROC) scored a total of 251.73 and took the silver while Kaori Sakamoto (JPN) came third with 233.13. The results are provisional.
